text: تنزيل الكتب لا ريب فيه من رب العلمين

translations.translation: The revelation of the Book, without any doubt of it, is from the Lord of the worlds.
The revelation of this Book free of doubt and involution is from the Lord of all the worlds.
This Book, beyond all doubt, was revealed by the Lord of the Universe.
There is no doubt that this Book is revealed by the Lord of the Universe.
The revelation of the Book is, without doubt, from the Lord Of The Creation.
The revelation of the Book in which there is no doubt, is from the Lord of all that exists.
The revelation of the Book, there is no doubt in it, is from the Lord of the worlds.
The sending down of the Book, wherein no doubt is, from the Lord of all Being.
The revelation of the Scripture whereof there is no doubt is from the Lord of the Worlds.
This Book has beyond all doubt been revealed by the Lord of the Universe.
Revelation of this Book, whereof there is no doubt, is from the Lord of the Worlds.
The [gradual] sending down of the Book, there is no doubt in it, is from the Lord of all the worlds.
(This is) the Revelation of the Book in which there is no doubt,- from the Lord of the Worlds.
The revelation of the Book (this Quran) is from the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists) in which there is not doubt!
The sending down of the Book in which there is no doubt that is from the Lord of the Worlds.
The revelation of the Book, without a doubt, is from the Lord of the Universe.
[This is] the revelation of the Book about which there is no doubt from the Lord of the worlds.

[32:2] The revelation of the Book, the Qur’ān (tanzīlu’l-kitābi, the subject) whereof there is no doubt (lā rayba fīh, the first predicate) from the Lord of the Worlds (min rabbi’l-‘ālamīna, the second predicate).
(The revelation of the Scripture) this Scripture is Allah's speech addressed to you (whereof there is no doubt) there is no doubt that it (is from the Lord of the Worlds.

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text:
{ تَنزِيلُ ٱلْكِتَابِ } الجامع لما في الكتب السالفة
 المبيِّن لأحكام دين الإسلام
 المنزل عليك يا أكمل الرسل
 لتأييدك وتوريح دينك { لاَ رَيْبَ فِيهِ } إنه نازل من الله الجامع لجميع الأسماء والصفات
 كما أن مرتبتك جامعة لجميع مراتب أهل العلم
 وأنت مبعوث إلى كافة الأمم
 ولذا صا كتابك نازلاً { مِن رَّبِّ ٱلْعَالَمِينَ } [السجدة: 2] يشكُّون ويترددون في نزوله من عنده سبحانه أولئك الطاعنون الضالون


{ أَمْ يَقُولُونَ ٱفْتَرَاهُ } واختلقه من تلقاء نفسه
 ونسبه إلى الله افتراءً ومراءً
 تغريراً وتلبيساً
 لا تحزن يا أكمل الرسل عليهم

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
هذا الذي تتلوه هو { تنزيلُ الكتاب لا ريبَ فيه } 
 لأنه معجز للبشر
 ومثله أبعد شيء عن الريب
 وهو { من ربِّ العالمين } لا محالة
 { أم يقولون افتراه } 
 أي: اختلقه محمد من عنده
 وهو إنكار لقولهم
 وتعجيب منه لظهور أمره في عجزهم عن الإتيان بسورة منه
